meanings.definition: A person who watches or observes something.
meanings.sent1: The watchers observed the birds in the park.
meanings.sent2: The watchers kept an eye on the suspicious activity.
meanings.sent3: The watchers giggled as they spied on their friend's surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The watchers stood like silent guardians in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The watchers' keen eyes never missed a detail.

meanings.definition: A group of people who keep watch over something.
meanings.sent1: The watchers patrolled the neighborhood to ensure safety.
meanings.sent2: The watchers took shifts to monitor the building 24/7.
meanings.sent3: The watchers shared stories to pass the time during their night shift.
meanings.sent4: The watchers formed a protective circle around the campfire.
meanings.sent5: The watchers' unity made them a formidable team.

meanings.definition: A device worn on the wrist to tell time.
meanings.sent1: The digital watchers beeped to remind her of the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The fancy watchers displayed both the date and time.
meanings.sent3: The colorful watchers matched her outfit perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The sleek watchers glinted in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The reliable watchers never failed to keep her punctual.
